result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Linn Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Straight time.  No release privileges.

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments while on probation; or to serve 10 days in HOC, consecutive.
Seek and maintain fulltime employment or be in a job training program as referred by agent.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant:   that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms, and that he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Complete a mental health evaluation.  Must comply with any recommended treatment.

No alcohol.  No  controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No association with known drug users or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Pay all supervision fees, to make regular monthly payments.

AODA assessment. Satisfactorily comply with any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then tested once per month, randomly.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive.  STAYED to be used by the agent for any violations: to serve 10 days for the first; 20 days for the second; and 60 days for the third.  Defendant shall then be revoked.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin Linn Martin in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Kevin Linn Martin in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court approves defendant to go into into dosage probation program, and approves early termination if defendant completes program.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 90 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:


- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 60 days for the third violation.  Defendant shall then be revoked.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and must comply with any recommended treatment.
- AODA assessment and satisfactorily comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Seek and maintain full time employment, or be in a job training program as referred by agent.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Attorney Bridget J Krause in court, defendant Kevin Linn Martin not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Defense informs the court that the state is not offering a DPA in this case, and wants to see if defendant can be accepted into drug treatment court.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 9/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for INTENSIVE Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.

Attorney Bridget J Krause in court.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/2/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Linn Martin in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Kevin Linn Martin in custody.  Paul Hauer for Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no drug paraphernalia.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kevin Linn Martin in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Kevin Linn Martin in custody.  Ann R Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
